issue.title: joint command message not interpreted properly

content.raw:
Please note that per pull request #169, the new recommended way to closing the control loop on Atlas is through UDP on topics:

[/atlas/atlas_state](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/5b79db87db77437f5c34e514fe2376cdf72afb61/ros/atlas_msgs/msg/AtlasState.msg?at=udp_tweak)
and [/atlas/atlas_command](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/5b79db87db77437f5c34e514fe2376cdf72afb61/ros/atlas_msgs/msg/AtlasCommand.msg?at=udp_tweak).

Both of these messages are designed so they are UDP friendly (< 1500 Bytes) and note that the `name` string array is not present, instead an enum list is provided in the state message definition.

At the same time, closing the loop through:

[/atlas/joint_states](http://ros.org/doc/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/JointState.html)
and [/atlas/joint_commands](#!/osrf/osrf-common/src/ff62f2b63df4d179801ac8ceca260389b8a56ab9/ros/osrf_msgs/msg/JointCommands.msg?at=default)

should switch to TCP and should be deprecated, as it is not safe to fragment these larger messages, causing ROS to hang after displaying TCPROS errors occasionally.
content.html:
Please note that per pull request #169, the new recommended way to closing the control loop on Atlas is through UDP on topics:

/atlas/atlas_state and /atlas/atlas_command.

Both of these messages are designed so they are UDP friendly (< 1500 Bytes) and note that the name string array is not present, instead an enum list is provided in the state message definition.

At the same time, closing the loop through:

/atlas/joint_states and /atlas/joint_commands

should switch to TCP and should be deprecated, as it is not safe to fragment these larger messages, causing ROS to hang after displaying TCPROS errors occasionally.
